items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 53 with Stirling Marcum
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: For this episode, Stirling Marcum is our guest as she joins Matt for a conversation about Psalm 53. Together they explore the connections of this Psalm with the story of Nabal and Abigail, the ways the psalm forces us to look at our own foolishness as well as the grace in the Psalm of having eyes open to God’s ongoing work.
items.contentSnippet: For this episode, Stirling Marcum is our guest as she joins Matt for a conversation about Psalm 53. items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 52 with Cheryl Maffei
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: First-time guest Cheryl Maffei joins the podcast to discuss Psalm 52. Together, Matt and Cheryl discuss the contrasts in this Psalm, its invitation into a life of abiding in God as well as the comfort that we can take in God’s ultimate vindication and judgment. A small programming note: Beginning this week, we are moving to an every other week release schedule (listen to the very end for a brief explanation why).

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 51 with Aaron Antoon
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Aaron Antoon is the guest for this episode about Psalm 51. Matt and Aaron discuss the context of this Psalm and its accessibility for us. They also consider how this psalm reminds us of God’s initiating work and his gift of a community that helps us pray as well as much more.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 50 with Grant Sork
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Grant Sork joins the podcast to discuss Psalm 50. Together, Matt and Grant talk about what makes this psalm unique, the ways it reminds us of God as the Creator Judge and particularly its invitation into an attentive listening to God. Enjoy the conversation!
items.contentSnippet: Grant Sork joins the podcast to discuss Psalm 50. Together, Matt and Grant talk about what makes this psalm unique, the ways it reminds us of God as the Creator Judge and particularly its invitation into an attentive listening to God. Enjoy the conversation!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 49 with Rachel Timms
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Rachel Timms returns to Curious Psalms to talk about Psalm 49. This unique wisdom Psalm talks extensively about wealth and little about God, so Matt and Rachel discuss both the ways it has helped them reflect on their resources as well as the ways it points to God as the one who brings life and redemption. Plus, they discuss some interesting punctuation choices!

Plus, they discuss some interesting punctuation choices!

Plus, they discuss some interesting punctuation choices!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 48 with Kevin Adams
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: The Reverend Dr. Kevin Adams joins Matt for this conversation about the enthusiastic Psalm 48. Together, they talk about the ways this Psalm reminds us that God is both a God of concrete places and of everyone and everywhere, as well as some specific prayer practices that could flow out of an encounter with this psalm. Plus, there’s a whole lot more about Jerusalem, the Church and God as our guide to the end.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 47 with Kyu Hahn
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: For one of his last conversations on Curious Psalms, Reverend Kyu Hahn returns to talk about the deeply joyful Psalm 47. Matt and Kyu discuss the ways joy combats a culture of content, how this psalm can be a model for our prayer and even how we may get glimpses of the meaning of Jesus’s ascension here.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 46 with Amy Langle
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Amy Langle returns for an honest and vulnerable conversation about Psalm 46. Matt and Amy discuss the Psalm’s call to “be still”, the comfort in God having an ultimate plan and serving as our refuge, and Amy shares a moment of personal revelation.
items.contentSnippet: Amy Langle returns for an honest and vulnerable conversation about Psalm 46. Matt and Amy discuss the Psalm’s call to “be still”, the comfort in God having an ultimate plan and serving as our refuge, and Amy shares a moment of personal revelation.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 45 with Libby Backfish
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: For Psalm 45, we had to have Dr. Libby Backfish join the podcast as Matt and Libby explore a unique wedding psalm, an unusual reference to God and a reminder of the fact that any human greatness comes from God. Plus they discuss how this can inspire us to pray for our leaders and be mindful of God in the midst of celebration.

Plus they discuss how this can inspire us to pray for our leaders and be mindful of God in the midst of celebration.

Plus they discuss how this can inspire us to pray for our leaders and be mindful of God in the midst of celebration.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 44 with Olivia Giles
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Olivia Giles joins the podcast to discuss Psalm 44, a corporate lament Psalm. The conversation explores the inscrutable ways of God, how that can actually help us pray and how, even in the hardships and challenges of our experience with God, we can rest on his unfailing love. Plus, tune in for a meaningful mention of the LEGO movie!

Plus, tune in for a meaningful mention of the LEGO movie!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 43 with Nathan Giles
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Nathan Giles is back for a conversation about Psalm 43. In this partner Psalm to Psalm 42, we talk about its particular movements, how it helps us explore and pray what we are experiencing as well as its invitation into a robust receptivity to God. We also take some time to explore an interesting phrase in v.1, “plead my cause” and what it means for God to both plead on our behalf and to be the judge. Enjoy this wide-ranging conversation!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 42 with Kyu Hahn
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content:
In this conversation on Psalm 42, Reverend Kyu Hahn is back on the podcast to talk about this fascinating Psalm that models a kind of spiritual self-talk. Together, we talk about the Psalm’s rhetorical questions, God’s presence in the midst of silence and how remembering and questioning can be welcome and helpful parts of praying.

Plus, as a bonus, listen to Sandra McCracken’s “My Help, My God” here.

Plus, as a bonus, listen to Sandra McCracken’s “My Help, My God” here.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 41 with Aaron Antoon
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: For this episode on Psalm 41, Aaron Antoon returns to discuss the ways our questions about God lead us into further exploration, how a single line from the Psalms can form a meaningful prayer, some of the particularly rich turns of phrase the Psalmist uses and much more. We hope you enjoy this conversation!

We hope you enjoy this conversation!

We hope you enjoy this conversation!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 40 with Heath Langle
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content:
For this episode on Psalm 40, Heath Langle joins the podcast. He shares what Psalm 40 means to him personally as we talk about its overflowing gratitude, humility and joy and how it reminds us of God’s care for both our past and our future. And that's just a taste - this conversation is full of thinking about the arc of the Bible, the universal and specific nature of poetry and the Psalms and more.

And, as promised, here’s a link to a video of a live performance of “40” by U2.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 39 with Joan Curry
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Joan Curry is our guest to discuss Psalm 39. We talk about the ways this Psalm invites us to be honest with God while recognizing our own limitations, as well as the reality that an encounter with God can be overwhelming. Joan also helpfully walks us through the movements of the Psalm and its invitation into humility.
items.contentSnippet: Joan Curry is our guest to discuss Psalm 39. We talk about the ways this Psalm invites us to be honest with God while recognizing our own limitations, as well as the reality that an encounter with God can be overwhelming. Joan also helpfully walks us through the movements of the Psalm and its invitation into humility.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 38 with Hannah Dungan
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Hannah Dungan joined the podcast to talk about Psalm 38, one of the penitential psalms. We explored together what it means for God to be fair, what it means that he will answer and the role that confession plays in our life. Plus, Hannah brings a bonus question as we discuss suffering in light of this psalm.
items.contentSnippet: Hannah Dungan joined the podcast to talk about Psalm 38, one of the penitential psalms. We explored together what it means for God to be fair, what it means that he will answer and the role that confession plays in our life. Plus, Hannah brings a bonus question as we discuss suffering in light of this psalm.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 37 with Kyu Hahn
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Reverend Kyu Hahn joins the podcast for a conversation about Psalm 37 and there’s lots to talk about! Together, we explore the complexities of doing good, our responsibility and God’s responsibility when it comes to justice and the transforming way the perspective of this psalm can impact our lives. Plus, we talk about laughing in prayer!

Plus, we talk about laughing in prayer!

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 37: A Reading
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content:
Enjoy this special episode where we invite you to pray along with Psalm 37. 

Special thanks to Gerry Adams, Grant Sork, Amy Langle and Kyu Hahn for reading the Psalm. The background music is "Shine" by Onycs.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 36 with Grant Sork
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Grant Sork returns to the podcast to discuss Psalm 36. We talk about the ways it contrasts the actions of the wicked with God's faithful love, some possible ways to think about the enigmatic reference to light in verse nine, and how the Psalm might help us pray beyond ourselves.

items.title: Psalm 35 with Dolly Leedy
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: On this episode, Matt is joined by Dolly Leedy to talk Psalm 35, the way it speaks uniquely to an experience of betrayal, and reminds us that God is the one who contends for us.
items.contentSnippet: On this episode, Matt is joined by Dolly Leedy to talk Psalm 35, the way it speaks uniquely to an experience of betrayal, and reminds us that God is the one who contends for us.

items.title: Psalm 34 with Kevin Adams
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Reverend Dr. Kevin Adams returns to talk about the beautiful acrostic Psalm 34 and its invitation into a life of gratitude and praise.
items.contentSnippet: Reverend Dr. Kevin Adams returns to talk about the beautiful acrostic Psalm 34 and its invitation into a life of gratitude and praise.

items.title: Psalm 33 with Luke Adams
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Luke Adams joins the podcast to talk about Psalm 33, its powerful reminders of our dependence on God and his care, and how God is like a little kid in creation.
items.contentSnippet: Luke Adams joins the podcast to talk about Psalm 33, its powerful reminders of our dependence on God and his care, and how God is like a little kid in creation.

items.title: Psalm 32 with Kyu Hahn
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Kyu Hahn joins Curious Psalms for a conversation about Psalm 32. In this episode, we explore the deep grace of God and how this psalm can help us be honest about ourselves with God.
items.contentSnippet: Kyu Hahn joins Curious Psalms for a conversation about Psalm 32. In this episode, we explore the deep grace of God and how this psalm can help us be honest about ourselves with God.

items.title: Psalm 31 with Libby Backfish
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Libby Backfish returns for her "reserved" conversation about Psalm 31 as we reflect on how this Psalm points us to God's protection and help us pray in the midst of God's goodness and our troubles.

items.title: Psalm 30 with Aaron Antoon
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Aaron Antoon joins the podcast again to talk about Psalm 30, how we process its "bargaining" verse, and how it helps us pray more honestly and uncensored.
items.contentSnippet: Aaron Antoon joins the podcast again to talk about Psalm 30, how we process its "bargaining" verse, and how it helps us pray more honestly and uncensored.

items.title: Psalm 29 with Nathan Giles
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Nathan Giles joins the podcast to help us listen to Psalm 29 and balance the judgment of the voice of the Lord with what it means for the Spirit to be at work in our own life. Enjoy this conversation!
items.contentSnippet: Nathan Giles joins the podcast to help us listen to Psalm 29 and balance the judgment of the voice of the Lord with what it means for the Spirit to be at work in our own life. Enjoy this conversation!

items.title: Psalm 28 with Rachel Timms
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Rachel Timms returns to the podcast to talk Psalm 28, David's confidence, what that means for our own prayers and how we pray in light of the kingdom of God.

items.title: Psalm 27 with Amy Langle
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Amy Langle joins the podcast again to explore Psalm 27, the way it expresses confidence in God and how it invites us into waiting.

items.title: Psalm 26 with Madi Trivits
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Madi Trivits returns to the podcast to talk about Psalm 26, wrestling with its language and how it can help us pray alongside others facing injustice.

items.title: Psalm 25 with Kyu Hahn
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Kyu Hahn returns for a discussion of Psalm 25, how it highlights our great neediness and how it helps us bring our neediness to a good and forgiving God.
items.contentSnippet: Kyu Hahn returns for a discussion of Psalm 25, how it highlights our great neediness and how it helps us bring our neediness to a good and forgiving God.

items.title: Psalm 24 with Olivia Giles
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Olivia Giles joins the podcast for the first time as we discuss Psalm 24, the vastness of God and how different perspectives can help us pray the Psalms more deeply.
items.contentSnippet: Olivia Giles joins the podcast for the first time as we discuss Psalm 24, the vastness of God and how different perspectives can help us pray the Psalms more deeply.

items.title: Psalm 23 with Kevin Adams
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: The Reverend Dr. Kevin Adams joins us for a conversation about the beloved Psalm 23 and how it is both uniquely accessible, widely known and never cliche.

items.title: Psalm 22 with Libby Backfish
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Dr. Libby Backfish returns to talk about Psalm 22 and how Jesus takes up these words and helps us lament.

items.title: Psalm 21 with Kyle Trivits
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: In this episode, Kyle Trivits joins the podcast to talk about Psalm 21, the ways its description of the king points us beyond the Psalm and the challenges of praying the psalmist's words.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 20 with Aaron Antoon
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: Aaron Antoon returns to the podcast to consider Psalm 20, what victory means for us, and how this psalm of blessing calls us to pray for others.

items.creator: Curious Psalms
items.title: Psalm 18: A Reading
items.dc:creator: Curious Psalms
items.content: In this episode, you're invited to pray along with Psalm 18. Look for the next episode for a conversation about this Psalm.  Thanks to Kevin Adams, Madi Trivits and Amy Langle for their reading and to Scott Buckley for the use of his song...

creator: Curious Psalms
title: Curious Psalms
description: A podcast where we practice reading and praying the Psalms, the prayerbook of God’s people. Featuring our friends at Granite Springs Church.
author: Curious Psalms
